noun.description: The chemical element of atomic number 6, a nonmetal which has two main forms (diamond and graphite) and which also occurs in impure form in charcoal, soot, and coal.
Carbon dioxide or other gaseous carbon compounds released into the atmosphere, associated with climate change.
examples: the level of carbon in the atmosphere has been consistently rising
fossil fuel consumption and carbon emissions continued to rise

origin: Late 18th century: from French carbone, from Latin carbo, carbon- coal, charcoal.
